images.caption: Figure 1:An example of the bongard HOI task. Model must infer a common rule, in this case, "a person is performing a jump on a motorcycle," from the positive examples and determine if the query image follows this rule, which the negative examples do not.

Figure 3:generative accuracy vs. linear separability for all baseline models.
The diagonal dashed line is the LSC benchmark (y=x𝑦𝑥y=xitalic_y = italic_x).
Points above the line indicate that a model’s generative performance has surpassed its LSC.
The plot shows that most evaluations struggle to consistently surpass the benchmark, demonstrating a prevalent linear reasoning bottleneck.
